Perceptor/elita:

"If you want to catch him then the surprice factor is esencial"replie 
Perceptor"And about Nightlight, she STILL is in danger... not only her 
relationship with the his most hatest enemie also for her unusual spark. My 
sugestion is add her a stealth program that let her hide her signature and 
swich her signature too... and do same with the child"

--------------------------------------------------
From: "Sandy" <magicquartz@...>
Sent: Monday, October 18, 2010 11:51 PM
To: <nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com>
Subject: Re: The Awakening

> Tucson smiles gently to Elita's touch and returns it with a gentile 
> embrace of his own.  He was not aware of it, but his paternal instinct was 
> now beginning to set in.
>
> " With your father's help, and the assistance of the Maximals and 
> Autobots, we're going to teach Hydras a lesson about stealing something 
> that isn't his to begin with.  We're not about to let him get away with 
> what he did to your mother or to Rodimus and I'll be sure I get my point 
> across to them as well."
>
> He turns his head to Perceptor.
>
> "Perceptor, is there a way to establish a com link with Hydras?  I think 
> it's time I gave him fair warning."
>
> Night Shift re enters the room along with Straight Shot.
>
> " Somethn' tells me you're about ta put your foot down, Tucson."
>
> Tucson nodds.
>
> "Yes I am.  Hydras has gone too far and has paid no price for his actions. 
> Those days are over.  He may think he has won, but this battle has not 
> even started.  And I'm NOT walking away without a fight.  Not this time. 
> And not ever again.  He's done far too much damage and has even attempted 
> to fracture a family, and emotionally harming an innocent child, by taking 
> away the ones she loves the most.  That is my final straw."
>
> Straight Shot looks up to him.
>
> " With a name like yours, it was bound ta come ta this sooner or later. 
> You didn't get that name for nothing.  Even when you weren't a Prime, you 
> were still as tough as nails, even if you weren't the largest Autobot on 
> the team.  Rodimus is lucky ta have ya fighting beside him as a Prime. 
> Now with the two of you putting your feet down, you'll have him running in 
> the opposite direction with his tail between his legs, literally. And 
> Rodimus, now that I think of it, As I do for Tucson, my weapon alt modes 
> will also work for you in the event that Tucson is unfit to wield me."
>
> Tucson nodds.
>
> "She's right.  If anything happens to me, you are the one chosen to wield 
> Straight Shot.  She will not let you down, her aim is impecable, and she 
> never misses her target.  My trust in you is infinate, and I know you will 
> wield her well."
>
>
> --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, Airshadow Nightstar <airly2002@...> wrote:
>>
>> Perceptor/Elita:
>>
>> Elita hug Tucson tightly while she lloked her mom. Perceptor said 
>> dryly"We
>> found an unusual situation... both Programs Maximal and Predacon are 
>> running
>> at same time, with her memories fragmented, the situation is confused to 
>> her
>> and she wont know what side will choose. My best sugestion is eliminate 
>> both
>> programs and restore her memories and her identities circuits  once when
>> both are working in a proper way we can install the maximal program"
>>
>> --------------------------------------------------
>> From: "Sandy" <magicquartz@...>
>> Sent: Monday, October 18, 2010 10:51 PM
>> To: <nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com>
>> Subject: Re: The Awakening
>>
>> > Tucson holds Elita closser to him and gives her a kiss on her forehead,
>> > and then gently rubs her head with a genitle hand.
>> >
>> > " Words can not describe how you must have felt when your mother was 
>> > taken
>> > away from you. But when Rodimus was taken, like you my heart spark felt
>> > like it had shattered into a thousand pieces.  But I can tell you this. 
>> > I
>> > feel it deep down inside my spark, that your mother will return to you 
>> > and
>> > she will be very happy to see you once again."
>> >
>> > He listens to voices comming from the other's direction.  He then turns
>> > his head back to Elita.
>> >
>> > " About Perceptor, he really is trying hard to redeem himself, yet, I
>> > don't think the others quite understand how hard it is to do such a 
>> > thing.
>> > Like you, I see it too.  He's trying very hard to become one of us, but
>> > there are a few of our comrades who do not have as much faith as we do.
>> > Faith is important if we're going to combat Hydras.  We'll need it, and 
>> > if
>> > you have that faith, so do I.  Come, I think it's time we had a talk 
>> > with
>> > the other Autobots and Maximals."
>> >
>> > He gently carries Elita in his arm, and walks back into the room where 
>> > Kup
>> > and the others are.  His expression was quite serious at this point, 
>> > yet
>> > not one that would indicate anger so to speak.  Rat Trap now sees his
>> > expression and looks to the others.
>> >
>> > " I - do believe this is a good time for me ta go out'n try ta find
>> > somethn' ta eat."
>> >
>> > He gets into rat mode.  Quickstride transforms into his equine mode, 
>> > and
>> > follows him.
>> >
>> > "Yep, right on, my stomach's growling too..  Wonder if there's any more 
>> > of
>> > those bean pods out there.."
>> >
>> > Night Shift and Straight Shot also read the expression on their 
>> > leader's
>> > face.
>> >
>> > "Yeah, this would be a good time ta look for Energon deposits that we 
>> > can
>> > convert inta useable energy."
>> >
>> > Straight Shot nodds and joins Night Shift.
>> >
>> > "Good idea, never know when we'll need more fuel."
>> >
>> > Tucson was now alone with everyone in the room.
>> >
>> > " If we're going to gain the upper hand on Hydras, we have mostly
>> > everything we need, except for one thing, which is most imperative to 
>> > our
>> > cause.  Faith.  We have that with each other, but when it comes to 
>> > those
>> > who are trying to turn over a new leaf, I see a lack of it.  I can not
>> > stress enough on the importance of all around faith in each other.  If 
>> > we
>> > do not have that, we are not ready to confront our worst enemy. 
>> > Rodimus
>> > would surely agree with me, that faith is of the essence, because at
>> > first, I too was distrustful of Rodimus once he had been freed of the
>> > shell program.  But now I see where that distrust would have gotten me,
>> > and I too had to come around and give faith a chance.  I know we can do
>> > that, we're Autobots and Maximals.  We believe in each other, and now,
>> > among us, is a Predacon who has shown great courage by helping us here
>> > now.  Please, do not let distrust weaken your faith.  It's what Hydras
>> > would want, to see us fall and I'm not about to let that happen, and
>> > neither should any of you."
>> >
>> > He stands tall, holding Elita in his arm.  His posture as clearly as
>> > strong as Optimus Prime's, as well as his vocalizer which now bears
>> > striking resemblence to that of the legendary Autobot leader.
>> >
>> > --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, Airshadow Nightstar <airly2002@> wrote:

>> >> > Tucson chuckles, as he gently holds Elita.
>> >> >
>> >> > "Well, I do know a few things about Rodimus, in his younger years, 
>> >> > even
>> >> > before I became a Prime.  Before I was rendered blind, we'd do many
>> >> > missions side by side.  Of course, him being Hot Rod, a sports 
>> >> > vehcile
>> >> > and
>> >> > me, an average compact SUV, off roading vehicle, with no interest in
>> >> > speed, we'd often kid each other about speed versus rugged 
>> >> > durability
>> >> > over
>> >> > off road terrain.  One day, we were driving toward a mission to stop
>> >> > Galvatron's path of destruction, when our path got blasted by 
>> >> > unknown
>> >> > enemy fire.  We knew we couldn't let a rock slide stop us, and we
>> >> > didn't.
>> >> > I knew I could've just drove over it, and gotten to the other side 
>> >> > with
>> >> > no
>> >> > problem. But Rodimus wasn't built for that in his alt form.  We 
>> >> > never
>> >> > left
>> >> > each other's side that day.  We found a way to get around that 
>> >> > obsticle
>> >> > together, even though we had conflicting ideas on how to do it, but,
>> >> > eventually we did compromise and we thwarted Galvatron with the aid 
>> >> > of
>> >> > the
>> >> > other Autobots.  Sometimes opposites work well together, and Rodimus
>> >> > proved it that day.  I guess that's what drove me to rescue him. I
>> >> > couldn't think of how I would manage, if I had not had him by my 
>> >> > side."
>> >> >
>> >> > He gently rubs Elita's shoulders.
>> >> >
>> >> > "I wish I could remember what happened to Bumblebee and Spike, and
>> >> > Kremzeem, but after I was rendered off line for several vorns, I 
>> >> > lost a
>> >> > good portion of my memory. "
>> >> >
>> >> > Like Rodimus, Tucson's gentile embrace takes on a paternal aspect. 
>> >> > He
>> >> > holds Elita as if she were his own.
>> >> >
>> >> > " And don't you worry about your mother, Stanton will find a way to
>> >> > bring
>> >> > her back, I'm sure of it.  But you also have to keep that hope alive 
>> >> > in
>> >> > your heart.  The more hope, the more chances of her healing."
>> >> >
>> >> > Tucson was now swapping his status to a more parental role.  It felt
>> >> > good
>> >> > to be with Elita, and right at this moment, he wasn't about to trade
>> >> > that
>> >> > joy with anything else.
>> >> >

>> >> >> >>
>> >> >> >> The body and form of Optimus Prime remained absolutely still, 
>> >> >> >> there
>> >> >> >> was no discernable movement from him, no spark of energy, no 
>> >> >> >> sign
>> >> >> >> of
>> >> >> >> recognition of any type. It could be that the Matrix energy that
>> >> >> >> had
>> >> >> >> been animate before has been temporarily used up, or perhaps the

>> >> >> >> into
>> >> >> >> being. In either case Optimus prime looked, for all intents and

>> >> >> >> rebirth in another few million years.
